subject: Re: Web site updates - Living Kidney donation

full_threads.body:
Hi Chris,

All sorted. the slider’s in place now, rotating between the Step Into Spring and DonateLife images as discussed.

Let me know if you’d like any tweaks!

Actually Glen, maybe just add a slider so the step into spring and the donatelife image are both there alternatively.

Thanks

chris

Glen,

Could you please change the slider photo on our webpage to the one attached with a link to donatelife.gov.au as soon as possible please and let me know when it is done?

If it is not the right configuration you could potentially find something more suitable at: https://www.donatelife.gov.au/donatelifeweek-resources

Thanks

chris

Hi Chris,

Thanks for flagging both of these!

  • The Community Challenge page update is already done — I added the “Download the Challenge Poster” section in a clean two-column layout besides the “It’s free to join” block. The poster is embedded and ready to go.
  • Re: the spam in the comments section — we’re still working on the best fix for this. Ideally we’ll disable comments altogether, but if that proves tricky, we’ll look at routing approvals to contactus@transplant.org.au as a fallback. Will keep you posted either way.

Let me know if anything else comes up — always happy to help!

Glen,

Two things please.

On the https://transplant.org.au/community-challenge/ page the second block down it says download the app etc.

Under its free to join can you put in a bold heading - I think that's the best place for it, we just need to make it obvious. If it doesn't work there it could be in its own block your call:

Download the Challenge Poster to share with the community: Step Into Spring Community Challenge

(embed the poster attached).

--

We are getting a lot of spam on the comments section - they land in my inbox waiting to be approved. My preference is just to turn this comments section off. Alternatively if that's not possible can the approval process go to contactus@transplant.org.au?

Thanks

Chris

attachments.filename: Step into Spring Transplant Community Challenge Poster.pdf

full_threads.body:
Glen,

Fantastic, thanks for your prompt attention to this.

Have a great day.

chris

Hi Chris,

Just a quick note to let you know the six fact sheets have now been added to the Community Challenge page, just below the sign-up section as requested:
https://transplant.org.au/community-challenge/

Each one has a thumbnail with the title, and clicking them opens the PDF in a new tab. Let us know if you’d like any tweaks to layout or wording—we’re happy to adjust.

All sorted on our end—feel free to reach out if anything else pops up!

Hi Glen and Andy,

Can we please add some PDFs to the following page you created for us:

https://transplant.org.au/community-challenge/

There are six fact sheets.

It would be good if they could be displayed under the sign up section at the bottom under the heading:

Challenge Fact Sheets

1 - Getting Active

2 - Help To Get You Started

3 - Plan Your Program

4 - Measuring Exercise Intensity

5 - Sticking With It

6 - Exercising After a Heart or Lung Transplant

I am thinking a thumbnail image of each with the heading of the fact sheet below or above it. The thumbnail would open a new page to the PDF.

This task can be undertaken anytime and hopefully completed end of next week.

Cheers

Chris
closing this ticket now, no response from client

Hi Jo

Can you send us a screenshot?
This is what i see on my end:

Hi Glen

I noticed that the Step into Spring image on the homepage is not appearing well now on the computer, but is now OK on the phone I think?

Are you able to check this? Or if you need me to supply it in a different format, please provide specs.

Thanks

Jo

Jo O'Farrell
Manager - Stakeholder Engagement
I’ll go ahead and publish it now.

Thanks Glen

This looks great and ready to publish please.

Thanks

Jo

Thanks for flagging. I’ve now:
https://transplant.org.au/homepage-new/

  • Adjusted the Step into Spring banner so the logo scales properly on mobile. It should display cleanly across all devices now.
  • Linked the banner directly to the Community Challenge page.

Let me know if you want any content or visual tweaks on that page before publishing.

Hello Glen

Thanks for your work on the new home page. Looks good.

Before publishing, please can you
- check the Step into Spring banner - as the logo is not fully visible on the phone. Is there something you can do to fix this?
- create a weblink from the Step into Spring banner through to the Community Challenge page

Many thanks

Jo
